author: Peter Funt
title: Consign ‘Dossier’ to the Round File
text:
Today I am releasing a dossier about a word that is driving many of us absolutely crazy. If you can’t tell what the word is from the preceding sentence, you haven’t been watching three or four hours of cable news each day like a normal person.

“Dossier,” borrowed from the French, entered the English lexicon around 1880. Our ancestors were pretty much tired of saying it by about 1887—although it later became a staple in B movies. Then, in 2016, a real-life British ex-spy named Christopher Steele wrote a series of 17 memos about...
